refnamediv.refpurpose: Access groups of files as if they were a single large file

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: vcat is a wrapper around concat-fuse that allows accessing groups of files, selected by a glob pattern, as if they were a single large file.
vcat works by mounting the virtual filesystem concat-fuse and then accessing a file within it that acts as if it contained all the individual files concatenated.

refsect1.title: Example
refsect1.para: A simple example of vcat use would look like this:
refsect1.programlisting: $ echo "File Number One" > /tmp/1.txt $ echo "File Number Two" > /tmp/2.txt $ cat $(vcat "/tmp/*.txt") File Number One File Number Two
refsect1.para: Note that the glob pattern must be quoted for it to work.

refsect1.title: Bugs
refsect1.para: vcat will only accept a single glob pattern per call and doesn't provide a way to reorder them.
